meanings.definition: Capable of being crushed or pulverized.
meanings.sent1: The cookies were triturable, easily breaking into small pieces.
meanings.sent2: The triturable rocks turned into fine sand after being crushed.
meanings.sent3: The triturable paper was so fragile that even a gentle touch tore it apart.
meanings.sent4: Her triturable dreams shattered like glass when she heard the news.
meanings.sent5: The triturable leaves crumbled under the weight of the heavy rain.

meanings.definition: Able to be ground into a fine powder.
meanings.sent1: The triturable spices added a flavorful dust to the dish.
meanings.sent2: The triturable coffee beans turned into a fine powder in the grinder.
meanings.sent3: The triturable chalk created a cloud of dust when it hit the floor.
meanings.sent4: His triturable patience was wearing thin as he waited for hours.
meanings.sent5: The triturable sugar dissolved instantly in the hot tea.
